key_points: Houston is starting a cleanup process after a historic winter storm.
Mayor Sylvester Turner announced a new Winter Storm Relief Fund for Houston and Harris County.
The program's specifics on fund allocation were not detailed.
Public donations are being solicited for the relief fund.
The fund aims to assist with plumbing, home repair, temporary housing, and more.
CenterPoint Energy President and CEO Dave Lesar and others joined Turner at the announcement.
Hundreds of thousands in Houston were affected by the winter storm.
Leaders including Turner, Hidalgo, and U.S. Sen. Ted Cruz were also impacted by power losses.
The winter storm fund is set up amid COVID-19 and follows other disaster recovery efforts such as from the Watson Grinding explosion and Tropical Storm Imelda.
Updates on various disaster recovery programs are available on the city of Houston's recovery page.
spokespersons: Dave Lesar (President and CEO, CenterPoint Energy)
